document_data.name: Rashemi
document_data.mainbody: '''Rashemi''', also known as '''Rasallesian''',{{Cite web/Candlekeep forum|title=Rashemi & Jotun Languages ... Need Some Help.|author=[[Thomas M. Costa]]|topicid=20231|postid=470450|whichpage=1|date=2015-06-13|accessdate=2015-08-24}} was the language of the people of [[Rashemen]].{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|26}}
document_data.Speakers:
In addition to Rashemen, Rashemi was spoken by inhabitants of [[Altumbel]], the [[Great Dale]], the [[Hordelands]], [[Narfell]], [[the Ride]], [[Thay]], [[Thesk]], and [[the Vast]]. Some of the [[elf|elves]] of the [[Forest of Lethyr]], [[Sildëyuir]], and the [[Snow Eagle Aerie]] also spoke this tongue. [[Planetouched]] [[human]]s from [[Mulhorand]] sometimes learned the language as well. Even so, Rashemi was usually only spoken regularly within the borders of [[Rashemen]], and in fact, of all those of the [[Rashemi]] ethnicity living in [[Faerûn]], more spoke [[Thay]]an [[Mulhorandi language|Mulhorandi]] than spoke Rashemi.

In addition to [[Sylvan]], the [[spirit folk]] in the region of [[Lake Ashane]] spoke Rashemi as their primary language.
document_data.Script: Rashemi employed the [[Thorass alphabet]], which was introduced to Rashemen by [[Chondathan]] traders traveling along the [[Golden Way]].
document_data.History: Rashemi was in the [[Raumtheran languages]] group,{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|29}} the collection of languages originating in the [[Raumathar]]i Empire. It was derived primarily from [[Raumvira]]
document_data.Examples: Common female given names in Rashemi include Fyevarra, Hulmarra, Immith, Imzel, Navarra, Shevarra, Tammith, and Yuldra. Common male names are Borivik, Faurgar, Jandar, Kanithar, Madislak, Ralmevik, Shaumar, and Vladislak. A Rashemi surname might be Chergoba, Dyernina, Iltazyara, Murnyethara, Stayanoga, or Ulmokina.
